title: dsb - data schema for buildings
description: This data schema allows to exchange detailed data about buildings. It is meant to be used for the whole life cycle of a building, from the early planning of a building project to construction to facility management to recycling. For each value of this data, there is exactly one key in the schema. The most important purpose of the schema is to make it easy to develop software which interprets the data correctly. If you should miss any key, please propose it at the website to be included in the next updata of this schema.

string.description: If a string depends in no case on a language and if no restrictions on the string are possible, then this type is used.

latinString.description: If a string MUST use the Latin alphabet, the this type is used.

internationalString.description: It has been decided to keep everything in English so far. If other languages are included at a later stage, this structure makes it easy.

central.title: Buildingenvelopedata.org issues the central identifiers and guarantees their uniqueness.
central.description: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) or Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) is a 128-bit number. It is used to identify entities like components, institutions, methods and many more.

decentral.title: Any institution registered at buildingenvelopedata.org can issue decentral identifiers. The institution MUST guarantees their uniqueness.

uniqueId.description: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) or Globally Unique Identifier (GUID) is a 128-bit number. It is used to identify entities like components, institutions, methods and many more.

issuedBy.description: This UUID defines the institution which issues the UUID. This institution MUST guarantee the uniqueness of the UUID.

centralOrDecentral.title: This definition is used when either a central identifier or a decentral identifier can be used. For example, a component can be a general product. In this case, it usually has a central identifier from buildingenvelopedata.org. But a component can also be a specific instance of a product in a specific building. In this case, it usually has a decentral identifier from the owner of the building.

webAddress.description: In extension to the validation keyword `hostname`, a `webAddress` includes a `scheme` like https and possibly a `path` like /folder/item. TODO: Add an additional regex which checks whether the uri contains a `hostname`.

number.description: If the number is in all cases 100% certain and if no restrictions on the numbers are possible, then this type is used.

integer.description: If the integer is in all cases 100% certain and if no restrictions on the numbers are possible, then this type is used.

confidenceInterval.description: The confidence interval defines the probability that the true value lies within the uncertainty. The first three values belong to the standard errors 68.3% (one sigma), 95.4% (two sigma) or 99.7% (three sigma).

numberWithUncertainty.title: If a value may have an uncertainty and no further restrictions on the numbers are possible, then this type is used. The mean value is defined by `uncertainValue`, the uncertainty by `uncertainty` and the confidence interval by `confidenceInterval`.

oneOf.description: If the value is 100% certain, then this this option is used.

nonNegativeNumber.description: If the number is in all cases 100% certain and when only non-negative numbers are valid, then this type is used.

nonNegativeInteger.description: If the integer is in all cases 100% certain and when only non-negative integers are valid, then this type is used.

nonNegativeNumberWithUncertainty.title: If a value may have an uncertainty and only non-negative numbers are valid, then this type is used. The mean value is defined by `uncertainValue`, the uncertainty by `uncertainty` and the confidence interval by `confidenceInterval`.

oneOf.description: If the value is 100% certain, then this this option is used.

nonNegativeIntegerWithUncertainty.title: If an integer may have an uncertainty and only non-negative integers are valid, then this type is used. The mean value is defined by `uncertainValue`, the uncertainty by `uncertainty` and the confidence interval by `confidenceInterval`.

oneOf.description: If the value is 100% certain, then this this option is used.

numberBetweenZeroAndOne.title: This type is used when only numbers between 0 and 1 are valid and no uncertainty can occur.

numberBetweenZeroAndOneWithUncertainty.title: If a value may have an uncertainty and only numbers between 0 and 1 are valid, then this type is used. The mean value is defined by `uncertainValue`, the uncertainty by `uncertainty` and the confidence interval by `confidenceInterval`.

oneOf.description: If the value is 100% certain, then this this option is used.

numberBetweenZeroAndHundred.title: This type is used when only numbers between 0 and 100 are valid and no uncertainty can occur.

numberBetweenMinusAndPlusHundred.title: This type is used when only numbers between -100 and 100 are valid and no uncertainty can occur.

numberBetweenMinus90AndPlus90.title: This type is used when only numbers between -100 and 100 are valid and no uncertainty can occur.

numberBetweenMinus180AndPlus180.title: This type is used when only numbers between -100 and 100 are valid and no uncertainty can occur.

numbersWithUnits.title: This section defines types for numbers with units

meterWithUncertainty.description: Meter is the SI unit for length. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

meter.description: Meter is the SI unit for length. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

nanometer.description: This number represents a length in nanometers. 1 nm equals 10^(-9) meters. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

squareMeterWithUncertainty.description: A square meter (m^2) is a unit for an area. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

squareMillimeterWithUncertainty.description: A square millimeter (mm^2) is a unit for an area. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

squareMillimeter.description: A square millimeter (mm^2) is a unit for an area. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

cubicMeterWithUncertainty.description: A cubic meter is a unit for a volume. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

degree.description: A unit to measure angles. A full rotation equals 360°. This type is used for cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

radian.description: A unit to measure angles. A full rotation equals 2*Pi. This type is used for cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

wattWithUncertainty.description: Watt (W) is the SI unit for power. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

watt.description: Watt (W) is the SI unit for power. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

kelvinWithUncertainty.description: Kelvin (K) is the SI unit for temperature. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

kelvin.description: Kelvin (K) is the SI unit for temperature. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

voltWithUncertainty.description: Volt (V) is the SI unit for electric potential. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

volt.description: Volt (V) is the SI unit for electric potential. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

ampereWithUncertainty.description: Ampere (A) is the SI unit for electric current. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

ampere.description: Ampere (A) is the SI unit for electric current. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

ohmWithUncertainty.description: Ohm is the derived SI unit for electric resistance. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

ohm.description: Ohm is the derived SI unit for electric resistance. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

ohmPerMeterWithUncertainty.description: Ohm per meter is a unit for the electric resistance depending on the length. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

ohmPerMeter.description: Ohm per meter is a unit for the electric resistance depending on the length. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

kilogramWithUncertainty.description: Kilogram (also kilogramme, kg) is the SI unit for mass. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

pascal.description: Pascal (Pa) is the SI unit for pressure. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

hertzWithUncertainty.description: Hertz (Hz) is a derived SI unit of frequency. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

hertz.description: Hertz (Hz) is a derived SI unit of frequency. This type is used for rare cases in which the option of an uncertainty is not desired.

kgPerCubicMeterWithUncertainty.description: The density of a material has the SI units kg/m^3. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

JPerKgKwithUncertainty.description: Joule per kilogram and per Kelvin (J/(kg*K)) are the SI units of the specific heat capacity. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

kgPerSecondWithUncertainty.description: Kilogram per second (kg/s) are the SI units of the mass flow. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

wattPerSquareMeterKelvinWithUncertainty.description: Watt per square meter and per kelvin (W/(m^2*K) are the SI units of a heat transfer coefficient. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

wattPerMeterKelvinWithUncertainty.description: Watt per meter and per kelvin (W/(m*K)) are the SI units of the thermal conductivity. With this type, the uncertainty can be defined.

created.description: The date when this data was first stored in the database.

from.description: The earliest date for which the data is valid.

until.description: The latest date for which the data is valid.

from.description: The earliest date at which it was available.

until.description: The latest date at which it was available.

contact.title: In this section, you find all contact data for an institution or person.

phone.description: Phone number of an institution or person

address.description: Postal address of an institution or person

email.description: E-mail address of an institution or person

website.description: Website of an institution or person

basicStakeholder.title: A stakeholder can be either an institution or a person. This section collects the basic data of stakeholders.

id.description: This id represents the stakeholder.

explanation.description: This explanation can specify the role of the stakeholder.

person.title: This section collects all data about a person.

id.description: This id represents the person

family.description: The family name(s) also known as surname(s) or last name(s) of a person in Latin alphabet.

given.description: The given name(s) also known as forname(s) or first name(s) of a person in Latin alphabet.

id.description: This id which defines the affiliation of the person

name.description: The name of the affiliation of the person

institution.title: This sections collects data about an institution.

id.description: This id represents the institution

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of the institution in Latin alphabet.

explanation.description: The explanation can further explain the role of the institution.

items.description: A public key of the institution for cryptograpic signatures for approvals.

roles.title: This section collects the definitions of the various roles which an institution or a person can have.

owner.description: The owner holds the rights for example on a component and is defined by an id.

submitter.description: The submitter submits data to a database and is defined by an id.

manufacturer.description: The manufacturer manufactures or supplies the component and is defined by an id.

approver.description: The approver states that data or a method fulfills certain requirements. She is defined by an id.

admin.description: The admin is in charge of a database and is defined by an id.

author.description: An author is a person who is named as one of the authors of a publication. This person is defined by an id.

developer.description: A developer is a stakeholder who has developed a method or component. This stakeholder is defined by an id.

creator.description: A creator is a stakeholder who has created a data set. This stakeholder is defined by an id.

standardizer.title: A standardizer is an institution which has issued a standard. This institution is defined by an id.

id.description: This id represents the institution which has created a standard.

abbreviation.description: Abbreviation of the standardizer in Latin alphabet.

explanation.description: This explanation can specify the role of the institution which has created a standard.

id.description: This id represents the method which is specified below.

explanation.description: Here the method can be described in free text.

categories.title: With this array, it is defined whether the method is a measurement or a calculation only or both.

developer.description: This section defines who developed the method.

reference.description: If the method is an implementation of a standard or of a procedure described in a publication, this reference can be defined here.

created.description: This date defines when the method was created.

valid.description: Here you can define since when the method is valid and until when. This can be helpful for example when a regulation or standard changes.

available.description: Here you can define since when the method has been available and until when. This can be helpful for example when a method is shared considerably later than when it was created. You can also use it to define that the method may have been available for a long time even though it may not be valid for the whole time of its availability.

calculation.description: Here you can define the calculation procedure in detail.

calculation.title: This section is used to refer to a web address which defines the calculation procedure in detail.
calculation.description: If the calculation procedure is open, the web address should refer to the repository for example at github.com. If the calculation procedure is closed, the web address should provide an explanation of procedure and may describe options to download executables.

reference.title: This section is used to refer to one standard or one publication.

standard.description: This section defines which standard is refered to.

publication.description: This section defines which publication is refered to.

identifiers.title: For publications, there cannot be a single institution guaranteeing the uniqueness of ids. Therefore, several options to define a publication are presented starting with the most important ones.

doi.description: The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) is a very important persistent identifier for publications. It MUST be defined here if it is available for a publication. TODO: Improve the regex pattern to further restrict the string.

arXiv.description: arXiv.org is a free and open-access archive for publications. The arXiv identifier can be used to define a publication. TODO: Improve the regex pattern to further restrict the string.

urn.description: A Uniform Resource Name (URN) can be used to define a publication. TODO: Improve the regex pattern to further restrict the string.

webAddress.description: If a persistent identifiert like DOI is defined above, this webAdress can define a convenient web address to access the publication. However, if no persistent identifier exist, this web address is the only identifier of this publication. In this case, it is important to choose a web address with a high probability to persist long.

items.description: This array lists all persons which have authored the publication

standard.title: Standards are a special kind of publications. Therefore their data structure is different from publications.

id.description: The id represents this specific standard.

title.description: The full title of the standard

items.description: Each institution which has created this standard is defined here by its id.

standardizerIds.description: Standards typically do not name authors, but an institution or several institutions which created the standard. The institutions are identified by their id.

numeration.description: A standard may be named `ISO 52022-1` or `ASTM E2387`. While `ISO` and `ASTM` are the abbreviations for the standardizers, `52022` and `2387` are the main numbers. `E` is the prefix and `1` is the postfix which may indicate for example a part number. This classification facilitates the search, because there are multiple ways to refer to a standard.

year.description: It is important to define the year in which the standard was issued because there can be relevant updates of one standard.

section.description: The section of the standard to which the reference refers to.

standard.description: `ISO 52022` is an example of the abbreviation of a standardizer and the main number of the identifier.

database.description: Information about a database which has implemented the same API specification.

webAddress.description: The database is identified by its API endpoint.

explanation.description: A description of the database

owner.description: The institution which owns the database

admin.description: The institution which administrates the database

valid.description: For which timespan the data of the database is valid

available.description: For which timespan the database is or was available

internalComment.description: If there are any specific issues with a database, the administrators can use this string.

approvals.title: If the validity of a data is important, this section can be used to express the approval of a institution with a cryptographic signature. It's an array, because there may be approvals of several institutions for the same data.

id.description: The id represents this approval.

approver.description: This id represents The stakeholder who approved the data.

verify.description: This section defines how the approval can be verified.

signature.description: This string defines the cryptographic signature of the approved data.

valid.description: For which timespan the approval is valid

website.description: The URL of the website where the approval can be verified.

explanation.description: Explanation how the approval can be verified

possiblePositions.title: The locations where a component can be used

items.description: (i) 'exterior' means that the component can be used on the external side of the building envelope. (ii) 'asBuildingEnvelope' means that the component can be used as building envelope without any additional components. (iii) 'inBetween' means that the component can be used within building envelope for example between two glass panes. (iv) 'interior' means that the component can be used on the internal side of the building envelope.

colour.description: This section offers several ways to define the colour of a component

name.description: The name of the colour in common language

CRI.description: The Colour Rendering Index (CRI) indicates how well for example the transmitted radiation matches daylight.

CIELAB.description: The three parameters L*, a* and b* from CIE define the colour as well as the brightness.

formatting.title: This section is used to define the format of data.

id.description: The id represents this specific format.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of the format in Latin alphabet.

name.description: The full name of the format

explanation.description: The decription of the format

version.description: This id represents a specific version of the format.

reference.description: If the format is defined in a standard or a publication, this reference can be defined here.

file.title: This section defines the data of a specific file.

webAddress.description: The file can be downloaded directly from this URL.

explanation.description: An explanation of the file

formatting.description: The definition of the format of the file

creator.description: The stakeholder who has created this file

approvals.description: This section contains approvals of the file

created.description: The date when the file was created

valid.description: The timespan during which the file was valid

installed.title: This geometric definition of the dimensions refers to the installation of the component in a building envelope and a view perpendicular to the building envelope. The dimensions can be used to define a bounding box which includes all parts of the component. If a component can be installed in different ways, more than one set of dimensions can be defined.

height.description: The height of the component along the vertical axis of the building envelope. It has the units meter.

width.description: The width of the component along the horizontal axis of the building envelope. It has the units meter.

depth.description: The depth of the component along the axis perpendicular to the building envelope. It has the units meter.

independent.title: When the dimensions of a component are defined independent of a specific installation or coordinate system, then the dimensions can only be sorted by their values. The dimensions can be used to define a bounding box which includes all parts of the component.

smallest.description: The smallest dimension of the component. It has the units meter.

intermediate.description: The dimension of the component which is larger the `smallest` and smaller than `largest`. It has the units meter.

largest.description: The largest dimension of the component. It has the units meter.

basics.title: This section presents definitions to describe the geometry of a component.

centerOfGravity.description: Definition of the center of gravity of the component

dimensions.description: Height, width and depth of the component.

coordinateSystem.description: Definition of the coordinate systems to which the other coordinates refer to.

bodies.description: This array lists all the bodies of which the component consists.

file.description: Instead of or in addition to the keys above, a file can be used to define the geometry of the component.

LOD.title: The Level of Development or Level of Detail (LOD) is used to describe how accurate the reality is modelled. As geometry/LOD refers to geometry, it is sometimes also called Level of Geometry.

items.description: This integer indicates the LOD according to the definition of the reference below.

reference.description: This reference defines the LOD which is indicated above.

point.title: This section defines a point according to the definition of a coordinate system elsewhere.

vector.title: This section defines a geometric vector according to the definition of a coordinate system elsewhere.

coordinateSystem.title: Definition of the coordinate system of the data set

reference.description: The coordinate system needs to be well defined. If no suitable reference exists, please create a new publication in the database.

items.description: Often, a right-handed cartesian coordinate system is used.

NURBS.title: A non-uniform rational B-spline (NURBS) surface is a very general way to define a surface. It is created by two NURBS curves.
A non-uniform rational B-spline (NURBS) is a very general way to define a curve.

degree.description: The degree of a NURBS curve defines the polynomial degree of the basis functions of the curve. For degree=1, the curve is a linear interpolation between the control points.

controlPoints.title: The control points have a strong influence on the shape of the curve.

items.description: If the curve is 3D, the 3D points are appropriate. For 2D curves, the value for the z-axis should be 0.

weights.description: The weight of a control points determines its influences on the shape of the curve.

controlPoints.description: The number of control points plus the degree plus 1 has to be equal to the number of knots.

items.description: Each knot is a number which is either equal or larger than the preceding knot. Although usually the control points are used to shape the curve, the knots could also be used for this purpose. The first and last knot are usually repeated so that the curve ends exactly at these points.

knots.description: The number of control points plus the degree plus 1 has to be equal to the number of knots.

brep.title: Boundary representation (brep) defines a component by the surfaces between solid and non-solid.
brep.description: This array lists all surfaces between solid and non-solid of the component.

assembly.title: One component can either consist of a single component or of an assembly of components. This section is used to define an assembly of components. Each item of the array defines one component of the assembly.

coordinateSystemAssembly.description: Definition of the coordinate system of the assembly.

assemblyList.title: This list defines subcomponents which are used for this assembly.

id.description: The id represents a specific component of the assembly.

geometry.description: The reference defines the geometry of the component.

coordinateSystemComponent.title: The assembly has a coordinate system and each component has its own coordinate system. This section defines coordinates of the origin and axis of the component within the coordinate system of the assembly. Often, it is easier to define this relation than to convert all geometries into the coordinate system of the assembly.

origin.description: This point defines the coordinates of the origin of the component within the coordinate system of the assembly.

firstAxis.description: The coordinate system of the component has three axis. This vector defines the direction of the first axis within the coordinate system of the assembly.

secondAxis.description: The coordinate system of the component has three axis. This vector defines the direction of the second axis within the coordinate system of the assembly.

thirdAxis.description: The coordinate system of the component has three axis. This vector defines the direction of the third axis within the coordinate system of the assembly.

gaps.title: The gaps for example between a blind and the frame can be important for example regarding glare.

items.description: The item defines whether the shading is inside the reveal or outside or something beyond both categories.

dTop.description: dTop is usually the distance between the top of the shading and the rest of the building envelope. It is defined exactly in the reference below.

dBot.description: dBot is usually the distance between the bottom of the shading and the rest of the building envelope. It is defined exactly in the reference below.

dSide.description: dSide is usually the minimum thickness of the air gap between the side of the shading layer and the rest of the building envelope. It is defined exactly in the reference below.

dGlaz.description: dGlaz is usually the distance between the shading and the glass pane facing the shading. It is defined exactly in the reference below.

reference.description: This reference defines all parameters of this object.

angles.title: This sections defines angles which are helpful to characterize building envelopes.

tilt.description: For horizontal slats, the slat tilt angle is measured from the horizontal plane. 0° means fully open slats and 70° almost closed slats.

maximumClosing.description: The maximum closing angle is the highest possible slat tilt angle, typically because the slats touch each other.

source.title: The source data is the data which has been the starting point and on which a method was applied by the creator of the new data set.

id.description: The id represents the data source.

name.description: A data set can have a name.

explanation.description: This string can explain the source data for humans.

origin.title: Origin can be used to define how the data was created.

creator.description: The creator of the new dataset is identified here.

method.description: The method which has been applied by the creator on the source data is identified here. This method may be a combination of submethods.

source.description: The source data has been the starting point for the creator. If the method is a measurement, there may be no source data.

database.description: The database, where the source data and the method can be found, is identified here.

efficiencies.title: For the conversion of energy into another, this section provides definitions for effiencies.

photovoltaic.description: The photovoltaic efficiency of a component which uses irradiance to provide electric power.

solarThermal.description: The solar thermal efficiency of a component which uses irradiance to provide heat.

inverter.description: The efficiency of an inverter which converts for example direct current into alternating current.

bidirectional.title: This array defines connections between two components without defining a direction for these connections.

connectionType.description: The id defines the type of the connection.

id1.description: Id1 represents the first component which is connected to the component represented by id2.

id2.description: Id1 represents the second component which is connected to the component represented by id1.

length.description: The length of this connection in meters.

resistance.description: The electric resistance of the connection in ohms.

items.description: The electric connection can either be in parallel or in series or a more complex pattern.

id.description: The id represents the material.

version.description: This id represents a specific version of the material.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of the material in Latin alphabet.

explanation.description: An explanation with more details about the component

chemicalElements.description: In this array, the most important chemical elements can be named by the two letters of the periodic table of elements.

items.description: Components of the category material can have the subcategories of this array which further specifies the material.

characteristics.title: This section collects the characteristics of a material.

refractiveIndex.description: The refractive index is needed to calculate to calculate the path of irradiance through different materials.

density.description: The density is needed to calculate the weigth of the layer.

possiblePositions.description: PossiblePositions defines where the material can be used.

thickness.description: If the material has to flat parallel surfaces, then the thickness is the distance between both surfaces. It has the SI unit meter.

thermalConductivity.description: The thermal conductivity of a material quantifies its ability to conduct heat. It has the SI units W/(m*K).

PoissonsRatio.description: The Poisson's ratio is a measure of the expansion of a material in the direction perpendicular to the load. It's a dimensionless quantity.

YoungsModulus.description: The Young's Modulus is a measure for the stiffness of a solid material. It has the SI unit Pascal.

items.description: Components of the category layer can have the subcategories of this array which further specifies the layer.

characteristics.title: This section collect the characteristics of components of the category 'layer'.

possiblePositions.description: PossiblePositions defines where the layer can be used.

items.description: The orientation axis is important for example for venetian blinds.

slat.title: For example venetian blinds consist of many slats. This section is used to define characteristics for such slats.

thickness.description: If the slat is made from a sheet or plate with a certain thickness, this thickness can be defined here. It has the SI units meter.

pitch.description: Pitch is the distance between the rotation axis' of two neighbouring slats.

crownHeight.description: When a slat lies on a horizontal surface, the Crown Height is the distance between this surface and the heighest points of the slats.

oneOf.description: Usually, the shape of a slat is best described by a 2D curve of its cross section.
If the shape of the slats needs to be defined in 3D, a surface can be used.

tilt.description: For horizontal slats, the slat tilt angle is measured from the horizontal plane. 0° means fully open slats and 70° almost closed slats.

maximumClosing.description: The maximum closing angle is the highest possible slat tilt angle, typically because the slats touch each other.

gaps.description: This section defines the gaps for example between a blind and the frame. They can be important for example regarding glare.

items.description: Components of the category unit can have the subcategories of this array which further specifies the unit.

characteristics.title: This section collects the characteristics of components of the category 'unit'.

possiblePositions.description: PossiblePositions defines where the unit can be used.

gaps.description: This section defines the gaps for example between a blind and the frame. They can be important for example regarding glare.

currentVoltage.title: The current-voltage characteristic can be important for example for photovoltaics.

V.description: The electric potential difference in volts.

photovoltaic.title: This section provides a structure for data about photovoltaic modules which convert irradiance into electricity.

module.title: A photovoltaic (PV) module consists of PV cells which are connected and turn irradiance into electric power.

coordinateSystem.description: The coordinate system is defined by a reference to a publication or standard.

rectangular.title: If the BIPV module is rectangular with the same amount of cells in each row and the same distances between them, then this section can be used to describe the geometry. 'longitudinal' is the direction with the larger number of cells and 'transversal' with the smaller number of cells. More complex BIPV modules can be defined below as a 'cellList'.

longitudinal.title: 'longitudinal' is the direction with the larger number of cells.

cellNumber.description: The number of cells in the longitudinal direction.

spacing.description: The distance between two neighboring cells in the longitudinal direction and in metre (m).

transversal.title: 'transversal' is the direction with the smaller number of cells.

cellNumber.description: The number of cells in the transversal direction.

spacing.description: The distance between two neighboring cells in the transversal direction and in metre (m).

cellTypes.title: This array defines which types of cells are used in the PV module.

id.description: The id represents one type of PV cells.

explanation.description: This string can explain the cell to humans.

efficiency.description: The effiency of the cell is measured at standard test conditions.

nominal.description: The nominal power of the cell is measured independently at standard test conditions in watts.

effective.description: The effective nominal power of a cell is the nominal power of the module divided by the number of cells.

width.description: If the cell has more or less the form of a square, then the width between two parallel sides is helpful to calculate how many cells fit into one module.

currentVoltage.description: The current-voltage characteristic is important to calculate the PV performance for conditions other than the standard test conditions.

items.description: A photovoltaic cell can have one or more of these categories. For example, Copper indium gallium selenide PV is a thin film and solid state PV technology and would be described by the corresponding six items in the array.

cellList.title: This section can be used to define the cells with a higher level of detail than 'rectangular'. 'cellList' lists each cells of the PV module.

id.description: The id represents one specific cell in the photovoltaic module. It is used to define connections to other parts of the PV module.

cellType.description: The id represents one type of PV cells as defined above.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry and location of the cell.

diodeTypes.title: This array defines the type of diodes which are used in the the PV module.

id.description: The id represents one type of diodes which is used in the the PV module. The id is used to define connections to other parts of the PV module

explanation.description: This string can explain the cell to humans.

diodeType.description: The id defines the type of the diode.

explanation.description: This string can explain the connection type to humans.

resistancePerLength.description: The electric resistance of the connection per length of the connection in ohms per meter.

colour.description: The reference offers several way to define the colour of the connection.

connectionList.description: This section defines a list of all connections between cells and between cells and diodes.

category.description: If the connections are in series or parallel, this can be defined here.

moduleLayers.title: PV modules typically consist of several layers, for example a glass pane, a lamination material and the PV cells.

material.description: This sections defines the material of the layer

materialProperties.description: All properties which depend on the material in general and not on the specific component.

items.description: Typically, a PV module consists of a front cover layer, a front embedding layer, a cell layer, a rear embedding layer and a backing layer. The layer can therefore be defined by multiple strings.

thickness.description: The thickness of this layer as part of the module.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry and location of the layer including its dimensions.

colour.description: The reference offers several way to define the colour of the component.

junctionBoxType.description: The id defines the type of junction box.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry and location of the junction box.

items.description: This array defines whether the electric plus or minus is connected to the ground.

connectionCables.title: The connection cables are outside of the PV module to connect it to other PV modules.

id.description: The id represents a type of connection cables.

crossSection.description: The cross-sectional area of the connection cable in square millimeters.

positive.description: The length of the connection cable with the electric plus sign.

negative.description: The length of the connection cable with the electric minus sign.

id.description: The id represents the type of connector with which the connection cable is connected to another PV module.

name.description: The name of the connector type.

frame.title: PV modules often have a frame which increases the mechanical stability of the module.

material.description: This sections defines the material of the layer

materialProperties.description: All properties which depend on the material in general and not on the specific component.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry and location of the cell.

colour.description: The reference offers several way to define the colour of the component.

nominal.description: The nominal power is measured at the maximum power point of the module under standard test conditions.

tolerance.description: The tolerance of the nominal power of the module in percent. For example, '5' means, that the nominal power can be 5% larger or smaller than the value provided above.

temperatureCoefficient.description: When the temperature increases compared to standard test conditions, the nominal power changes. The temperature coefficient has the unit percent per Kelvin (%/K) to quantifies this change.

guarantee.title: This section defines if a guarantee is available specifically for the nominal power of the module. It is defined by fractions of the nominal power until a certain number of of years. For example, `years`=10 and `percentage`=90 means that 10 year old modules have at least 90% of their nominal power. `percentage`=0 means that no guarantee for the power is provided.

years.description: This number defines the amount of years until which a certain minimum percentage of the nominal power is guaranteed.

percentage.description: This number defines which fraction of the nominal power in percent is guaranteed as minimum after the amount of years which are defined above.

angleDependency.title: The nominal power usually depends on the direction of irradiance. In general, the `incidenceDirectionModifier` can characterize this dependency on the direction. If the dependency has a rotational symmetry regarding the incidence angle, `incidenceAngelModifier` should be provided.

incidenceAngleModifier.title: If the nominal power has an incidence angle symmetry regarding the direct irradiance, then this Incidence Angle Modifier (IAM) can be defined and plotted as a curve. It modifies the nominal power depending on the incidence angle.

IAM.description: `IAM` defines the value of the incidence angle modifier at the angle defined by `incidence`.

incidenceDirectionModifier.title: If the nominal power depends on the direction of the irradiance, this modifier can be multiplied to the nominal power.

direction.description: The section defines the direction of the incident radiation.

modifier.description: For the direction above, this `modifier` can be multiplied with the nominal power to determine the power at a this direction of incidence.

nominal.description: The nominal voltage is measured at the maximum power point of the module under standard test conditions.

openCircuit.description: The open circuit voltage is measured under standard test conditions without connecting the module to an electric circuit.

temperatureCoefficient.description: When the temperature increases compared to standard test conditions, the open circuit voltage changes. The temperature coefficient has the unit percent per Kelvin (%/K) to quantifies this change.

maximumSystem.description: The voltage of a PV system made with these modules should stay below this maximum system voltage.

nominal.description: The nominal current is measured at the maximum power point of the module under standard test conditions.

shortCircuit.description: The short circuit current is measured under standard test conditions with the module connected to an electric circuit which has an electric resistance of zero.

temperatureCoefficient.description: When the temperature increases compared to standard test conditions, the short circuit current changes. The temperature coefficient has the unit percent per Kelvin (%/K) to quantifies this change.

fillFactor.description: The fill factor is a measure of quality of a solar cell. It is the power at the maximum powerpoint divided by the open circuit voltage and the short circuit current.

efficiency.description: The effiency of the module is measured at standard test conditions.

weight.description: The weigth of the PV module.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry of the PV module including the dimensions width, height and depth (thickness).

safety.title: This section defines data about the safety of PV modules.

fire.title: This section defines the fire safety class of the PV module depending on the region for which the class is valid.

EN.title: This section defines the fire safety class according to the regulations of the European Union. EN 13501-1 defines the categories as well as the additional classification for smoke development and burning drops falling from the component.

items.description: The abbreviation define the fire safety class according to EN 13501-1.
Abbreviations for smoke according to EN 13501-1.
Abbreviations for burning drops according to EN 13501-1.

mechanical.title: Mechanical load tests verify that a module can withstand wind and snow.

rated.description: The maximum rated pressure in Pascal.

tested.description: The maximum tested pressure in Pascal.

rated.description: The maximum rated suction in Pascal.

tested.description: The maximum tested suction in Pascal.

reference.description: The reference defines for example the standard according to which the mechanical test was performed.

items.description: noPerformanceDetermined defines that no tests of the mechanical loads are available.

reference.description: If the PV module passed a hail test, then the reference can refer for example to a standard according to which the test was performed.

items.description: noPerformanceDetermined defines that no hail test results are available.

temperatures.title: This section defines the operating temperatures.

minimum.description: The minimum operating temperature in Kelvin (K).

operating.description: The operating temperature of the cells under standard test conditions and in Kelvin (K).

maximum.description: The maximum operating temperature in Kelvin (K).

guarantee.title: This section defines if a a general guarantee for the product. It is defined by the number of years and can refer to a publication or standard for details. `years`=0 means that no guarantee is provided. It is an array so that references for different number of years can be defined.

years.description: This number defines the number of years for which the manufacturer offers a guarantee for this module.

reference.description: The reference can define a publication or standard with details of the guarantee.

colour.description: The reference offers several way to define the colour of the component.

uValue.description: The U value, also known as thermal transmittance, characterizes the rate of heat transfer through this PV module.

inverter.title: Usually, an inverter is used to convert the direct current (DC) of the modules into alternating current (AC).

id.description: The id represents the inverter.

trackerNumber.description: The number of maximum-power-point (MPP) trackers which the inverter provides.

inputNumber.description: The number of DC input ports which the inverter provides. To each input port, one string of PV modules can be connected.

maximum.description: The maximum input power from the PV modules to the inverter in watts.

nominal.description: The nominal output power of the inverter in watts.

maximum.description: The maximum output power of the inverter in watts.

normalized.description: The output power at maximum efficiency divided by the nominal output power. It is a number without units.

night.description: The power demand of the inverter at night in watts.

minimum.description: When the input voltage decreases below this value, the inverter switches from operation into standby.

start.description: When the input voltage increase above this value, the inverter switches from standby to operation.

maximum.description: The maximum input voltage for the inverter.

minimum.description: The minimum frequency of the AC output of the inverter in hertz.

maximum.description: The maximum frequency of the AC output of the inverter in hertz.
The maximum input current for the inverter in amperes.

shortCircuit.description: The maximum short circuit current of the the inverter in amperes.

nominal.description: The nominal AC output current of the inverter in amperes.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry of the inverter including the dimensions width, height and depth (thickness).

safety.title: This section defines data about the safety of the inverter.

electric.title: This section defines the electric safety of the inverter.

IPcode.title: This section defines the electric safety according to the International Protection Marking, also called Ingress Protection Marking. Codes between IPXX and IP69K are defined. `standard` defines which standard defines the details of the of the IP code. `firstDigit` defines the protection against solid particles and the `secondDigit` against liquid ingress. `thirdDigit` is optional and defines the access to dangerous active parts. `fourthDigit` is optional, too, and can define additional information.

items.description: The item defines according to which standard the IP code is defined below.
The item defines the first digit of the IP code.
The item defines the second digit of the IP code.
The item defines the optional third digit of the IP code.
The item defines the optional fourth digit of the IP code.

applianceClass.title: The appliance protection classes define which protective-earth connection requirements are fulfilled.

items.description: The item defines according to which standard the appliance class is defined below.
The item defines the appliance class.

temperatures.title: This section defines the operating temperatures.

minimum.description: The minimum ambient temperature in Kelvin (K) for the inverter to operate.

maximum.description: The maximum ambient temperature in Kelvin (K) for the inverter to operate.
The maximum efficiency of this inverter. The efficiency has no units.

European.description: The efficiency of this inverter according to the european regulations. The efficiency has no units.

system.title: A photovoltaic (PV) system consists of PV modules which are connected and turn irradiance into electric power.

coordinateSystem.description: The coordinate system is defined by a reference to a publication or standard.

modules.title: This array defines the modules of the PV system.

id.description: The id represents one specific PV module in the PV system. It is used to define connections to other parts of the PV system.

moduleType.description: The id represents one type of PV modules.

geometry.description: This section defines the geometry and location of the PV module.

explanation.description: This string can explain the cell to humans.

diodeType.description: The id defines the type of the diode.
